title: "Master the Art of Growing Tomatoes in Your Small Garden: Ultimate Guide for Garden Champions!"

subtasks: Choosing the right tomato varieties
Selecting a sunny spot in the garden
Ensuring wind protection for tomato plants
Preparing the garden soil for tomatoes
Planting the tomato seeds or seedlings at the correct spacing
Fertilizing tomato plants with a balanced mix
Watering tomato plants regularly
Ensuring soil is well-drained
Amending soil with compost, peat moss, or aged manure
Checking soil pH and adjusting if necessary
Planting tomatoes deeply, burying some lower leaves
Ensuring proper spacing between plants
Choosing a sheltered location in the garden
Planting near a fence or windbreak

tasks.task: Choosing tomato varieties suitable for small spaces
subtasks: Researching compact or bush varieties
Considering dwarf varieties like patio princess, tiny tim, or bush early girl
Selecting cherry or grape tomato varieties
Considering suitable cherry or grape tomato varieties like sweet 100 or sun gold
Watering regularly, especially during hot summer months
Avoiding overwatering to prevent root rot
Applying compost or fertilizer at planting time
Reapplying fertilizer every few weeks during the growing season
Ensuring at least 6-8 hours of direct sunlight daily
Choosing the sunniest location in the garden

tasks.task: Spacing plants for good air circulation
subtasks: Planting tomatoes 18-24 inches apart
Ensuring sufficient space for air circulation
Observing tomato plants for wind sensitivity
Adjusting planting location if necessary
Regularly checking for signs of pests and diseases
Implementing preventative measures such as good air circulation and wind protection
Monitoring for ripe tomatoes
Picking tomatoes when they are fully colored and slightly soft
Handling ripe tomatoes with care to avoid bruising
